    • Method Detail

      • createArrayGenerator

        public static Tuple.Generator createArrayGenerator​(int width,
                                                   int height)
        Creates a generator that generates coordinates like a 2D array.

        i: first dimension j: second dimension

        Each iteration results in a 2-tuple

        Parameters:
        width - maximum value for i
        height - maximum value for j

      • createRadialHexGenerator

        public static Tuple.Generator createRadialHexGenerator​(int radius,
                                                       int centerx,
                                                       int centery,
                                                       int centerz)
        Creates a generator that starts at 0,0,0 in a hex grid and generates coordinates in a radius around the origin, i.e. max(|x|,|y|,|z|) <= radius for all points generated.

        x: first cube coordinate dimension y: second cube coordinate dimension z: third cube coordinate dimension rad: current radius being worked on dir: specifies which direction to go on each repetition. rep: repetition counter where the (x,y,z) are modified

        Each iteration results in a 3-tuple

        Parameters:
        radius - maximum value for rad
        centerx - coordinate offset for x value
        centery - coordinate offset for y value
        centerz - coordinate offset for z value

      • createRadialHexGenerator

        public static Tuple.Generator createRadialHexGenerator​(int radius)

      • createTriangleHexGenerator

        public static Tuple.Generator createTriangleHexGenerator​(int layers,
                                                         int invert,
                                                         int centerx,
                                                         int centery,
                                                         int centerz)
        Creates a generator that starts at 0,0,0 in a hex grid and generates coordinates in layers of triangles around the origin, i.e. (|x|+|y|+|z|)/2 <= 2*layers for all points generated.

        x: first cube coordinate dimension y: second cube coordinate dimension z: third cube coordinate dimension layer: current layer being worked on dir: specifies which direction to go on each repetition. rep: repetition counter where the (x,y,z) are modified

        Each iteration results in a 3-tuple

        Parameters:
        layers - layers in the triangle
        invert - Evenness designates triangles orientation
        centerx - coordinate offset for x value
        centery - coordinate offset for y value
        centerz - coordinate offset for z value
